prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions:** **Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Within the sketch, create a circle (circle\\_1) with center at [0.375, 0.375] and radius of 0.375. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.2354 to create the 3D model. **Part 2: Intermediate Part for Tapered Middle Section** (Note: The instructions for this part assume that the previous part, Part 1, has already been created.) 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Within the sketch,create multiple loops and faces as required to create a tapered shape that connects to the top surface of Part 1. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 1.0. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance greater than the height of Part 1 to create the 3D model. 7. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" to combine Part 1 and the new tapered part. **Final Shape: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Tapered Middle Section** (Note: The final shape assumes that Part 1 and the tapered part have been created.) 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Within the sketch, create a circle that matches the top surface contour of Part 1. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 1.0. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance greater than the height of Part 1 and the tapered part to create the final 3D model. The final shape has a height equal to the sum of the height of Part 1 and the tapered part, a width of 0.75, and a length of 0.75.</description>
